ilo: Investigate diverse perspectives on effective and ethical leadership in educational settings.
Interpret the impact of educational leadership on educators, families and children.
Critically analyse the application of leadership and change management theory and models to educational settings.
Advocate for children's rights in diverse educational contexts.
Evaluate teaching programs as part of a continuous improvement plan.
Synthesise and translate contemporary research on adult and child learning into effective partnerships, programs and practices.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Essay: A written task on leadership, ethics and advocacy in education
Presentation: An oral presentation on leadership in early childhood education (3000 words equivalent)

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours (16 hours of on-campus classes and 8 hours of asynchronous online activities)
